ygData.subject: Re: Invisibility
ygData.msgSnippet: Ive walked under many griffins invisible.  Its possible some come with the ability to see invisible, but I do not believe it to be the norm.  I suppose I
ygData.messageBody:
Ive walked under many griffins invisible. Its possible some come with
the ability to see invisible, but I do not believe it to be the norm. I
suppose I should use more caution in the future just incase. I guess
now that I have my skills up, and invis is fairly reliable, I go a
little overboard on taking risks.

-----Original Message-----
From: Daniel Devorkin [mailto:devo@...]
Sent: Thursday, May 20, 1999 6:14 PM
To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
Subject: [eqenchanters] Re: Invisibility


From: "Daniel Devorkin" <devo@...>

Griffins and some other creatures besides undead can see invisible PC's
do
not trust your invisibility to always work agains every creature. I
found
out the same way about Grifiins as you did. And i know that undead can
see
you if your invisible unless you have invisibility to undead. but,
invisibilty is not the best way to travel.

----- Original Message -----
From: DeGirolami, Franck <degirolami@...>
To: Eqenchanters (E-mail) <eqenchanters@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, April 20, 1999 5:52 PM
Subject: [eqenchanters] Invisibility


> From: "DeGirolami, Franck" <degirolami@...>
>
> I gave up a level 16 dark-elf necro because their invisibility spell (
> gather shadows ) was very unreliable. One sad evening, coming back
from a
> very long quest that brought me to Kerra Island and South Karana, I
got
> hacked multiple times in Riverdale losing about 4 bubs of xp because
my
> invis wore off on me randomly. I got really pissed off that at level
16, I
> could not manage to cast a level 8 spell reliably and decided to start
> another character more appropriate for travelling since I was very
much
into
> research and quests.
> With my enchantress, I got invisibility at level 4 and used it some
times.
> It always seemed to work great but I might be wrong. Yesterday, I
found
out
> that this invisibility spell is as bad as gather shadows as a %$#%^^%$
> griffin nuked me a few seconds after I cast invisibility. Since then,
I've
> noticed the same kind on unreliability...but only since I made level
8...I
> might be wrong.
> Anyway, I would like to know how's the enchanter's invisibility like
at
> level 16 or 20 or more. CAN YOU COUNT ON IT?
> Thanks,
> Skara, the pissed-off dark-elf Necro from Fennin-Ro
> now known as Skara, the enchantress from Innoruuk
>
>
>
